title: Wildebeest
summary: Wildebeest (/ˈwɪldɪbiːst/ WIL-dib-eest,[1][2][3] /ˈvɪl-/ VIL-,[3] /-dəb-/), also called gnu (/njuː/ NEW or /nuː/ NOO),[4][5][6] are antelopes of the genus Connochaetes and native to Eastern and Southern Africa. They belong to the family Bovidae, which includes true antelopes, cattle, goats, sheep, and other even-toed horned ungulates. There are two species of wildebeest: the black wildebeest or white-tailed gnu (C. gnou), and the blue wildebeest or brindled gnu (C. taurinus).
